content.html:
good news: my Mastodon/fediverse timeline has already ramped up to the level of activity of my Twitter timeline

bad news: catching up on my Mastodon/fediverse timeline is now as noticeably bad for my mental health as Twitter was

content.html:
@Aaron Parecki I just came back after a few days, just to find almost 1,700 new posts in my stream. And I don't even have that many followers.

But some of them keep sending me threads that explode with hundreds of replies.

content.html: You are not going to like my answer, but it is the path of least resistance for me. I post *everything* first to my website, and my website handles syndicating it to Twitter and via ActivityPub.

content.html: and no I'm not actually using Mastodon, and yes everyone I've followed I've grouped into different lists, I don't have a "main timeline" to read. That's helped a lot, I can choose to dip into different communities when I want to.
